image.altText: a young boy smiling while sitting on the ground

props.synopsis: Richard Sione angrily interrogated Jason Galleghan before he began a ferocious assault which resulted in the death of the 16-year-old.

title.children: Man who led group of minors in fatal bashing of Sydney teenager jailed for 32 years

image.altText: couple thumbnail

props.synopsis: A husband and wife from Brisbane have been charged by Australian Federal Police for allegedly spying on behalf of Russia. Here's what authorities say caught their attention.

title.children: The red flags at the centre of AFP's suspicions about the couple charged with spying for Russia

image.altText: Biden speaks from behind a lectern with american flags behind him

props.synopsis: Joe Biden boasts and blames his way through a high-stakes appearance as questions over whether he should drop out of the upcoming election linger, writes North America correspondent Barbara Miller.

title.children: Vice-President Trump and President Putin of Ukraine — Joe Biden's gaffes keep coming, but he says he's not budging

image.altText: Joe Biden has a stern expression and points at something.

props.synopsis: The US president addressed the media with mounting calls for him to step down ahead of November's election, as opinion polls show Donald Trump increasing his lead in the wake of Mr Biden disastrous performance in last month's presidential debate.

title.children: Seven stand-out moments from Joe Biden's high-pressure press conference

image.altText: A young man wearing camouflaged clothing with a cigarette in his mouth

props.synopsis: Brock Greenwood is the seventh Australian killed in Ukraine. He is one of an unknown number fighting in 'brutal trench warfare' without military experience, an expert says.

title.children: Aussie killed in Ukraine among many 'lulled' to fight war without military training

image.altText: Burgess and Kershaw stand at a lectern speaking.

props.synopsis: Two Russian-born Australian citizens are accused of obtaining Australian Defence Force material to share with Russian authorities.

title.children: 'We know who you are': AFP chief warns Australians spying for foreign governments

image.altText: Composite of a man and woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Kira Korolev and her husband Igor mostly kept to themselves", say neighbours, who are surprised their unit complex is now the centre of a national espionage investigation.

title.children: Russian-Australian woman charged with spying offences was well-travelled, made lifestyle videos

image.altText: Render of western sydney airport

props.synopsis: One of the largest unfinished infrastructure projects in New South Wales could turn Wollongong and south-west Sydney into a region "of national significance", according to a new report.

title.children: Completing this mothballed 1980s rail line will create a NSW 'mega-region', lobby group says

image.altText: Holly Willoughby, one of Britain’s most high-profile television personalities.

props.synopsis: A British security guard who plotted in an online forum about kidnapping former This Morning presenter Holly Willoughby has been sentenced to life in prison.

title.children: British man sentenced to life in prison for attempted kidnap and murder of UK presenter Holly Willoughby

image.altText: Benji Marshall, wearing a hoodie and a head set, watches a game from the sideline

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall has apologised to the club's fans after his side was belted 58-6 by the Cronulla Sharks.

title.children: Benji apologises to fans after the Tigers are smashed 58-6 by Cronulla

image.altText: Bobby Hill, Darcy Moore and Isaac Quaynor walk off

props.synopsis: The AFL's reigning premier Collingwood is in danger of following a premiership by missing the finals after being outmuscled at the MCG by Geelong.

title.children: 'Time is running out': Collingwood's premiership defence on thin ice after loss to Geelong in crucial clash

image.altText: Tourists in Venice

props.synopsis: A Venetian councillor behind the measure introduced to thin out tourism says the trial run has been successful even though large crowds remain.

title.children: Venice's debated tourist fee expected to increase 'in coming years', says tourism councillor

image.altText: Paloma Picasso, with shoulder-length brown hair and brown jacket, smiles with closed mouth near large drawing in frame.

props.synopsis: The Picasso estate has contacted Tasmania's Museum of Old and New Art to express its regret about artist Kirsha Kaechele's faked Picasso artworks, but said it considers the matter to be now closed.

title.children: Picasso estate responds to MONA's faked artworks

image.altText: Brenden Hall and Madison de Rozario together with the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most experienced and well-known Paralympians are honoured, named as joint flag-bearers for the Opening Ceremony of the Paris Games next month.

title.children: Australia names flag-bearers for Paris Paralympics

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: John Setka has been a union official for about 40 years and CFMEU secretary for 12.

title.children: CFMEU boss John Setka steps down

image.altText: A bag of heroin in an unidentifiable hand.

props.synopsis: NSW's second drug summit will be held over four days this year, the government confirms.

title.children: 'Time for NSW to move on from punitive approaches': State to hold first drug summit since 1999

image.altText: couple, woman with plastic crown

props.synopsis: There are calls for legislative change as the inquest into the 2019 Corrective Services shooting death of Wiradjuri man Dwayne Johnstone ends with the coroner to hand down her findings and recommendations in late August.

title.children: Partner's 'devastating emptiness' as hearing into Corrective Services shooting of Dwayne Johnstone ends

image.altText: Old photo of ship

props.synopsis: The surviving families of the sailors aboard the SS Nemesis have held a memorial at the site of the wreck, uncovered by accident earlier this year, to mark 120 years since its sinking.

title.children: Descendents of SS Nemesis' shipwrecked sailors put 120-year-old 'mystery' to rest

image.altText: Four large winged aircraft sit on the back of trucks that are driving down a road while on parade

props.synopsis: Officials say the technology will allow them to shoot down unmanned aerial vehicles from the North but not all experts are convinced.

title.children: Dubbed the 'Star Wars Project', South Korea plans to use drone-melting lasers against North Korea

image.altText: Woman wearing an Akubra hat in selfie

props.synopsis: Call for the mandatory return of income support management has some on the edge of tears and fears people could leave towns to avoid the reintroduction.

title.children: 'Don't think we'd survive it': Anxieties that Morrison-era policy could return amid cost-of-living crisis

props.synopsis: A look into the transformative journey of Japanese anime from World War II propaganda reels to today's billion-dollar, Pokemon-filled world.

title.children: Would you spend half a billion dollars just to be 'cool'? Here's why Japan thought it was a critical investment

props.synopsis: A "callous" unsupervised learner driver who caused the death of his 19-year-old passenger Chelsea Maddox, then fled the scene, has been jailed for nine years but could be eligible for parole in less than two.

title.children: Learner driver who left teenage friend 'for dead' sentenced over fatal crash

image.altText: Shelley Duvall stands among a crowd of photographers. She looks over her right shoulder and smiles.

props.synopsis: Shelley Duvall's retreat from Hollywood was a favourite topic among internet sleuths throughout the years. In some of her last interviews, the former star gave insights into her disappearance.

title.children: Why Shelley Duvall disappeared from Hollywood

image.altText: A silhouette of a diver going fishing off NSW coastline

props.synopsis: A court has reversed the burden of proof in a long-running legal battle over cultural fishing rights between First Nations people and the NSW government.

title.children: Legal 'breakthrough' sees roles reversed for First Nations fishers forced to prove connection to country

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The family of two Australian victims of a suspected murder at a luxury resort in the Philippines have released a statement saying the situation is "like living a nightmare" and they are "praying for answers".

title.children: Philippines police open special investigation into suspected murder of Australian couple as hunt for suspect continues

image.altText: Michelle Law and her partner Dave stand cheek to cheek, smiling for a selfie.

props.synopsis: Before my partner and I moved in together, we made a spreadsheet to divide the "mental load" surrounding housework. It worked for more than a year, until significant life changes led us to take a different approach.

title.children: A spreadsheet helped us split the mental load until our lives changed

image.altText: A young woman kisses the head of a black furred greyhound.

props.synopsis: Lynn Maney has been training and racing greyhounds for more than 50 years, and says the industry has "improved enormously" in the past decade despite a report released this week from the former NSW head vet which claims there is widespread animal abuse.

title.children: 'It's just a way of life': Greyhound trainers in NSW insist the industry has improved as inquiry launched

image.altText: A female gymnast puts chalk on her feet.

props.synopsis: An Australian gymnastics coach selected for the Paris Olympics is accused of making comments about a former colleague's breasts and calling her a "minion".

title.children: 'You cannot use that word': Olympic gymnastics coach allegedly made comments about student's body

image.altText: A court sketch of Brendan Luke Stevens, who has a beard and wears a green shirt.

props.synopsis: Court hears from self-proclaimed leader of religious group and first responder, who says Elizabeth's father was "calm and collected" after the eight-year-old's death.

title.children: Religious group 'well within our rights' to believe God would save Elizabeth Struhs, leader tells court

image.altText: Chanel Loren, a black woman, wearing blue, big earrings, short black hair, gazing at camera, blue dress

props.synopsis: Recording artist Chanel Loren was feeling overwhelmed when she penned the track Ebony, which she describes as the audio hug she needed, before she realised it was bigger than just her.

title.children: 'The audio hug I needed': Chanel Loren's message to her inner child is bigger than herself

image.altText: Man with beard on motorcycle in rural setting

props.synopsis: John Griffin, who has previously pleaded guilty to manslaughter, "stomped on" his victim with steel capped boots, the South Australian Supreme Court has heard.

title.children: Man 'stomped on' victim before degrading acts on body, court hears

image.altText: Signs held by three people who's faces are not shown. One signs says 'end racism'.

props.synopsis: Findings in a Human Rights Commission report show governments across all sectors are failing to identify and deal with racism across the country. The country's Race Discrimination Commissioner says there are "systemic failures" in dealing with racism that need to change.

title.children: 'Not good enough': Governments fail on racism against First Nations and culturally diverse people, report finds

image.altText: Alec Baldwin with prayer hands to his face sitting next to a member of his legal team, wearing a suit, blue shirt

props.synopsis: On day two of Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial into the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins, the court heard from numerous witnesses including gun manufacturer Alessandro Pietta, who produced the weapon used on the set of Rust.

title.children: Gun manufacturer tells Alec Baldwin trial trigger needs to be pulled for weapon to go off

image.altText: An adult female varroa mite on the head of a bee it is parasitising.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor, test and treat infected colonies as varroa mite continues to spread throughout southern NSW, including to Bega near the Victorian border.

title.children: Bee killer varroa mite spreads further south. Now detected near Victorian border
